action.action-desc: Mr. Gosar (for himself, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Nehls, Mrs. Boebert, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Biggs, Mr. Rosendale, Ms. Hageman, Mr. Crane, Mr. Ogles, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Santos, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, and Mr. Moore of Alabama) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability

form.official-title: To require that information on spending associated with national emergencies be subject to the same reporting requirements as other Federal funds under the Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Emergency Expenditure Reporting Transparency Act.

section.header: Reporting on spending for national emergencies

subsection.text: Section 3(b)(1) of the Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006 (31 U.S.C. 6101 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C)(ii) by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (D)(ii) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: beginning not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this subparagraph, for each national emergency declared by the President under section 201 of the National Emergencies Act (50 U.S.C. 1621)—

subclause.text: of any other budgetary resources; and

clause.text: from which accounts and in what amount appropriations are obligated and outlays are made—

paragraph.text: Section 4(b) of the Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006 (31 U.S.C. 6101 note) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (6) by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (7) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: include unique identifiers for Federal funds made available or expended with respect to each national emergency declared by the President under section 201 of the National Emergencies Act (50 U.S.C. 1621).

Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the Secretary of the Treasury shall update the data standards established under section 4(a) of the Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006 (31 U.S.C. 6101 note(a)) to comply with the amendments made by this section.
